docs.summary: A registration form for an event.
description: You can use a `Form` to create a custom registration form for accepting RSVPs, with the
RSVP APIs ([SDK](https://dev.wix.com/docs/sdk/frontend-modules/events/rsvp/introduction) | [Velo](https://dev.wix.com/docs/velo/apis/wix-events-frontend/rsvp/introduction)),

or when offering tickets, with the Tickets APIs ([SDK](https://dev.wix.com/docs/sdk/frontend-modules/events/tickets/introduction) | [Velo](https://dev.wix.com/docs/velo/apis/wix-events-frontend/tickets/introduction)),
for events.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This object will be deprecated on March 30, 2026. Replace with the object from [getForm()](https://dev.wix.com/docs/sdk/backend-modules/events/forms/get-form).
description: > **Migration Instructions**
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`getForm()`](https://dev.wix.com/docs/sdk/backend-modules/events/forms/get-form).
> To migrate to the new method:
> 1. Add a backend file to your site.

> 2. Write a code so that it replaces the `formData` object from the frontend with the `getForm()` method's object from the backend. Export your backend function so that it can be used in the frontend.
> 3. Import your backend function into the frontend file. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The returned `FormData` object contains the information you need to create
a custom registration form for the specified event.
This information includes:
+ The event's registration status, such as whether registration is
open, closed, or guests will be placed on a waitl ist.
+ Which statuses guests can RSVP with, such as yes, no, or to be added
to the wait list.
+ Whether the event is a ticketed event.
+ Information about the registration form's fields, such as their names,
descriptive labels, and whether they're required.
> **Note:** The frontend Events APIs aren't functional when previewing a site. View a published version of a site to see their complete functionality.

body: const eventId = // Get the event ID

// When the form contains an address or additional
// guests, add code to add those values to formValues.

This example assumes that a form is built with input elements, where the element
 IDs match the field names retrieved from the `formData` property.

extra.description:
This example assumes that a form is built with input elements, where the element
 IDs match the field names retrieved from the `formData` property.

params.name: formValues
params.doc: Field names and values for a registration form.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - Validation result when validation passes.
Rejected - `FieldValidationError` when validation fails.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This method will be deprecated on March 30, 2026. Replace with [getForm()](https://dev.wix.com/docs/sdk/backend-modules/events/forms/get-form).
description: > **Migration Instructions**
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`getForm()`](https://dev.wix.com/docs/sdk/backend-modules/events/forms/get-form). The validation is now performed under the hood by the `getForm()` method.
> To migrate to the new method:
> 1. Add a backend file to your site.
> 2. Write a code so that it replaces the `validate()` method from the frontend with the `getForm()` method from the backend. Export your backend function so that it can be used in the frontend.
> 3. Import your backend function into the frontend file. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `validate()` method returns a Promise that resolves to `{valid: true}`
if the fields and values in the registration form are valid or rejects if there are
invalid fields or values.
When `validate()` is called, `validateInput()`
also runs for all your form fields.
The following are invalid when checked against the event's registration form
as defined in the site dashboard:
+ The specified form values contain a field that doesn't exist in the event's registration form.
+ The specified form values are missing a field that exists in the event's registration form. You
must also include non-required fields even if their values are empty.
> **Note:** The frontend Events APIs aren't functional when previewing a site. View a published version of a site to see their complete functionality.

examples.title: Validate a registration form
body: const eventId = // Get the event ID
// handle case where form is valid
// handle case where form is not valid
let message = error.message; // "Following fields have invalid IDs: nonExistent1, nonExistent2"

params.name: inputName
params.doc: Name of the input field to validate.

params.name: formValues
params.doc: Field names and values for a registration form.

ret.doc: An object representing whether the input value is valid.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This method will be deprecated on March 30, 2026. Replace with [getForm()](https://dev.wix.com/docs/sdk/backend-modules/events/forms/get-form).
description: > **Migration Instructions**
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`getForm()`](https://dev.wix.com/docs/sdk/backend-modules/events/forms/get-form). The validation is now performed under the hood by the `getForm()` method.
> To migrate to the new method:
> 1. Add a backend file to your site.
> 2. Write a code so that it replaces the `validateInput()` method from the frontend with the `getForm()` method from the backend. Export your backend function so that it can be used in the frontend.
> 3. Import your backend function into the frontend file. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
`validateInput()` returns `{valid: true}`
if the value in the specified field is valid and throws an error if it's not valid.
You may want to call `validateInput()` in an input element's
`onCustomValidation()`
to validate an input while the form is being filled out.
> **Note:** The frontend Events APIs aren't functional when previewing a site. View a published version of a site to see their complete functionality.

examples.title: Validate a registration form value
body: const eventId = // Get the event ID
// handle case where firstName is valid
// handle case where firstName is not valid
let message = error.message; // "First Name is required"

examples.title: Validate a form value in an element's `onCustomValidation()`
body: const eventId = // Get the event ID
let message = error.message; // "First Name is required"

examples.title: Create and submit a registration form
body: // Run a query that returns only one event. Add
// additional filtering to the query if necessary.
// When a form contains an address, the way you format the
// address information for submission depends on what type
// of input elements you use to gather that information.
// Single element which is not an address
// input element, such as a text input.
// When a form contains an input for adding more guests to an
// RSVP, format the guest names for submission in an array
// where each element is the full name of a guest.

members.name: formInputs
members.doc: Information about the input fields needed to create a registration form.

members.name: rsvpStatusOptions
members.doc:
Allowed RSVP statuses for an event. 
 One of: 

 + `"YES_AND_NO"`: Guests can RSVP for the event with a "Yes" or "No". 
 + `"YES_ONLY"`: Guests can only RSVP for the event with a "Yes".
 + `"WAITING"`: The guest limit has been reached, but there is an open wait list.

members.name: registrationStatus
members.doc:
Event registration status.
 One of:
 
 + `"OPEN_RSVP"`: Registration is open and guest limit hasn't been reached.
 + `"OPEN_RSVP_WAITLIST"`: Registration is open, guest limit has been reached,
   and additional registering guests are added to the wait list.
 + `"OPEN_TICKETS"`: Registration is open for a ticketed event and there are still
   tickets available.
 + `"OPEN_EXTERNAL"`: Registration is open for an event that uses external registration,
    not RSVP or ticketed. 
 + `"CLOSED"`: Registration is closed because the guest limit has been reached.
 + `"CLOSED_MANUALLY"`: Registration was closed manually.

members.name: isTicketed
members.doc: Whether the event is a ticketed event.

docs.summary: An object containing information about a form value.

examples.title: Create and submit a registration form
body: // Run a query that returns only one event. Add
// additional filtering to the query if necessary.
// When a form contains an address, the way you format the
// address information for submission depends on what type
// of input elements you use to gather that information.
// Single element which is not an address
// input element, such as a text input.
// When a form contains an input for adding more guests to an
// RSVP, format the guest names for submission in an array
// where each element is the full name of a guest.

members.name: value

docs.summary: An object containing information about an input field in a registration form.

examples.title: Get registration form data
body: const eventId = // Get the event ID

members.name: _id
members.doc: Unique input identifier.

members.name: array
members.doc: Whether the input field's value is an array.

members.name: label
members.doc: Input field display label.

members.name: additionalLabels
members.doc: Additional field display labels for complex fields.

members.name: options
members.doc: List of value options where applicable.

members.name: maxLength
members.doc: Maximum length of the input field's value. A value of `0` indicates no maximum length.

members.name: name
members.doc: Input field name.

members.name: required
members.doc: Whether the input field is required.

members.name: controlType
members.doc:
The type of the input field.
 One of:
 
 + `"NAME"`
 + `"INPUT"`
 + `"RADIO"`
 + `"CHECKBOX"`
 + `"DROPDOWN"`
 + `"GUEST_CONTROL"`
 + `"ADDRESS_FULL"`
 + `"TEXTAREA"`
 + `"DATE"`

members.name: valid
members.doc: Indicates that the registration form fields are valid.

docs.summary: An object representing an error that occurred during validation of an RSVP form's values.

examples.title: Validate an RSVP form's values
body: const eventId = // Get the event ID
// handle case where firstName is valid
// handle case where firstName is not valid
let message = error.message; // "First Name is required"

members.name: message
members.doc: Error message.

members.name: inputId
members.doc: ID of the input field that failed validation.

members.name: errorType
members.doc:
Error type.
 One of:

 + `"EMPTY_INPUT"`: A required field is missing its value.
 + `"INVALID_INPUT_VALUE"`: The value isn't valid for the field type.
 + `"INPUT_TOO_LONG"`: The value is too long.
 + `"INVALID_OPTION"`: The value doesn't match one of the defined options for the field.
 + `"INVALID_STATUS"`: The status value isn't valid.
 + `"INVALID_NUMBER_OF_GUESTS"`: The number of guests doesn't match the number defined for the form.
